iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade

other-identifier.owner-name: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade

iati-activity.title: Ghana - Alternatives for child labourers from the Fishing industry
iati-activity.description: Working with International Needs New Zealand in Ghana to establish local child labour committees which will identify and negotiate the withdrawal of children from labouring, or situations where they are at risk of becoming involved. They will be supported to access their preferred school or vocational training option and parents of these children will be supported through training and engagement in economic activity.

contact-info.organisation: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade

iati-activity.participating-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade

transaction.description: Expenses incurred during the financial year

iati-activity.reporting-org: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade

other-identifier.owner-name: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade

iati-activity.title: Ghana - Protection of Children from commercial sexual exploitation in Accra
iati-activity.description: Working with International Needs New Zealand to withdraw or prevent 500 children from commercial sexual exploitation in Ghana, and provide support to access school or vocational training, and counselling. Work will be done with families to improve their entrepreneurial skills, grow businesses and increase their incomes. The activity will also involve raising awareness in the community to address commercial sexual exploitation of children in the district.

contact-info.organisation: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade
